text: Carol Scrob (July 21, 1856 – January 17, 1913) was a Romanian poet, considered one of the figures of the native Symbolist movement. A graduate of the National College in Iași, he served time as an officer in the army, and began contributing to magazines such as "Literatorul" (1880-1884). He began publishing poetry collections in 1881, with Rime pierdute. ==References== Category:1856 births Category:1913 deaths Category:Romanian male poets Category:19th-century poets Category:20th-century Romanian poets Category:19th-century male writers Category:20th-century Romanian male writers
title: Carol Scrob
